Just a couple of quotes from one of my classes that I found interesting:


"But I am told that love is stronger than walls, and in this, lies my only hope. So beat down those walls with your firm but gentle hands, for the person/child in me is very sensitive and can't grow behind walls. So don't give up. I need you"

Leo Buscaglia


"Perhaps love is the process of my leading you gently back to yourself."

Not sure who wrote that, may have been my Professor.

I did it, I did it, I did it!!!!!  I finally have my Bachelors degree. It doesn't seem real, it hasn't really sunk in yet. It has been a long (way longer than 4 years) road to get here. It would have been easy for me to give up, but I didn't, and no one is prouder of myself for that than me.

My goal is to get my Masters degree, and I almost had decided to quit here and just get a job. It is a struggle to be a "professional" student, and it sucks not having any health insurance, but I would not have been happy with myself had I quit. I set a goal for myself, and I will reach that goal, come hell or high water. 

I have become to realize what a strong person I am. I can do anything I set my mind to. It feels good. It feels really good. I am my own destiny.. I am responsible for my successes and failures. I get very frustrated with people who like to blame others for their unhappiness, or people who whine because something is missing in their life. If you dont like your life, THEN CHANGE IT!! Get off of you ass and do something about it!! 

I also want to thank a special Daddy who has come into my life. I feel very lucky that you have chosen to take me on this journey. I have already learned so much about myself, and have realized that when I am free to be me, I am a pretty cool person. I really like myself. Most importantly, I am having a BLAST!! 

"Our ambition should be to rule ourselves, the true kingdom for each one of us; and true progress is to know more, and be more, and to do more." 
Oscar Wilde

Well, its been a busy couple of months. I did my internship at the DOC, 240 hrs, and made a friend out of the deal. Hopefully i will have my Bachelors degree very soon, as i am done with all of my classes.. YAY!!!!!!! It's been a long, long road to get to this point, and it's not over yet. I start my Masters degree next month.

My daughter came to visit me. She is so beautiful and i am very proud of her. We had a blast!

I am dating a Dom now. Not going to say to much about it because i am not sure where it will lead. We are still in the early stages and getting to know each other, but... I am having fun, and thats what counts. 

So life is pretty good right now..not perfect, but good.

I have been so busy with school. Never have I had this much work piled up on me. I guess being a senior, they expect more out of me.. yay me..lol. But I will be graduating this summer and start my Masters degree in the fall. So at least there is a light at the end of the tunnel. And when i finally do get my grad degree, i will be eligible for AARP.. woohoo, senior discount for coffee at McDonalds. LOL, No, I won't be that old, but old enough. 

A friend of mine in OKC messaged me last night and gave me some very interesting news.. I'm gonna keep it to myself but lets just say it put a little hitch in my giddy-up.. It put things in perspective for me.

I am looking forward to summer now.. i got the itch. Lounging out by the pool with a good book, feeling the warm sun on my body. The summer car shows, can't wait for that. My daughter will be here this summer, and i know she will want to go to Frontier City. She loves amusement parks and riding all the rides. I don't do the scary rides so I'm gonna have to find someone to go with us who will ride the scary rides with her.

Well, time to get back to writing my papers.. ughhh.

deb


"You have to keep plugging away. We are all growing. There is no shortcut. You have to put time into it to build an audience" 
John Gruber, How to Blog for Money by Learning from Comics, SXSW 2006

I did something today that I knew I needed to do.. I went to Lake Carl Blackwell in Stillwater. In August of 1944, my grandparents, and my mom and her siser, went to Stillwater to see my grandmothers sister. While they were there they went boating out at the lake. A swell came and sank the boat. No one knew how to swim and there were only 2 life jackets, which were given to my mom and her sister. Everyone else drowned. My mom was 6 yrs old, and she almost died too. They had to give her CPR to revive her. It took the rest of the day to recover the rest of the bodies. They had to bring in rescuers from OKC to help. It was said to be the lake's first drowning tragedy. 
I have a copy of the original newpaper article and it stated about where on the lake it happened. So I went there today, and stood on the bank, and looked out over the lake, where the accident happened. The lake was so calm and it was so quiet standing there. It was very cold and there was a light breeze.  It was hard to imagine that under that water was the boat that my mom and grandparents were on so long ago. I tried to visualize what happened, but I couldn't. I tried to imagine the horror my mom felt seeing her parents drown, but I couldn't. I tried to imagine what was going through my grandparents' mind, knowing that their death was saving their children, but I couldn't.  All I could do was just stand there, and look out over the lake, so calm and quiet, and wonder.

Well, concerning the drama from last year again. I am making one final step. and that is to come clean to anyone I have lied to. I know it may stir up some shit, but I need to do this. I was asked to lie to people under the context that they were treating someone I cared about, bad. I now find out that is not the case, and I feel it only right to apologize to these people. I just have to rememebr that it is not me causing the drama. It is the person who lied and asked me to lie who is the troublemaker. I am only bringing it to light. I too said bad things about people based on what I was told, and I apologize for that as well. I am planning on coming back to DP sometime in the near future and although people will think what they want about me, I will know I have done what I needed to make things as right as they can
 be.

So now I am done with it, it is behind me. Everyone that I cared about from then is back in my life in some form, and thats what really matters. i have talked to each of them and got things sorted out. As someone pointed out to me, "Karma is a bitch, and the Karma train backed up and dealt some justice".. Ohh to have been a fly on the wall....


deb



Frederick Douglass: 
I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.

Well, a few things have changed recently. One being I am no longer with my Dom, but we are still great friends, and still play when we get a chance, and i think the world of Him.

The second thing is that I have reconnected with some people. I went through alot of drama last year, partly my fault.. i did make alot of mistakes. Most of it, however, was someone else's doing. It's a shame really, that someone would waste their life on deceiving others.
Life is a learning experience and I have learned alot in the last year.


deb

It's sad that there is still so much racism around. I knew if i went out yesterday i was gonna hear someone acting ignorant, and i did. I had asked someone what the date was and she said "Don't you know? It's nigger day, coon day"... i don't think she realized how stupid she looked.




Martin Luther King, Jr.: 
"I look forward confidently to the day when all who work for a living will be one with no thought to their separateness as Negroes, Jews, Italians or any other distinctions. This will be the day when we bring into full realization the American dream -- a dream yet unfulfilled. A dream of equality of opportunity, of privilege and property widely distributed; a dream of a land where men will not take necessities from the many to give luxuries to the few; a dream of a land where men will not argue that the color of a man's skin determines the content of his character; a dream of a nation where all our gifts and resources are held not for ourselves alone, but as instruments of service for the rest of humanity; the dream of a country where every man will respect the dignity and worth of the human personality."

So I'll wait and see, maybe my mood will change. I'm glad school has started again. I was getting way too bored on break.



Victor Frankl:

I had a pretty hot scene on New Years Eve. I knew I would probably get to play, but I didn't think I would get into it as much as I did. I was uncomfortable at first, not knowing hardly anyone at the party. There were alot of people packed into the hotel room. I was standing, facing a door, with my hands restrained above me, and i had my shirt and bra off. It started off with a flogging, which was very nice. I was able to tune most of the noise out, and was getting into it. I was actually wanting more pain than i got.Everytime He hit me hard with the flogger i kept hoping He would do it again.. i was thinking "more, more". Even the stingy floggers, which I don't normally like, I wanted more of. Then came the knife play. I felt it on my back, it was very nice. But then, He came up close behind me, pulled my chin back with his hand, and started running the knife from my chest up to my throat. It was awesome.. the combination of feeling Him close behind me, feeling His breath in my ear, and holding my chin back... words can't describe it. I started feeling very lightheaded and extremely relaxed. All my muscles just loosened up. I think that was the first time that I really gave up all control mentally. I just let it happen. I trusted Him completely and was willing to go wherever He took me. 
I wished it would have lasted longer but we were short on time, it was almost midnight so we had to stop.

I was on collarme and was bored, so i was just randomly reading profiles and i came across a submissive's profile and this is what she had on there. I really liked it.



                               Understanding what Submissive means

                                         author unknown 



To understand the power of submission, one must first understand what being a submissive means, where it comes from and how it is expressed.

True submission is something that comes from deep within a person and is an essential part of their nature. It is something expressed from the soul and as such, it goes much deeper than the mere physical/sexual act of offering oneself to a Master for pleasure. A person can behave in a submissive manner but this is not the same as being "a submissive". 

To offer oneself completely and utterly to another, to surrender all choice and "power" requires an exceptional inner strength. High self esteem and a knowledge that in order to relinquish power to another as well as understanding that one must possess that inner power is essential.

Embracing and expressing my submissive nature has given me the most powerful opportunities to find the deepest levels of trust, power and the intimacy that can only arise from the bond of a Master and sub. It is the ultimate expression of balance, the archetypal opposition of yin (the receptive principal) and yang (the active principle). Both sides being perfectly equal, yet forming a perfect whole. 

As a submissive, my goals are to come before my Master as an empty chalice to be filled.....or a blank canvas to be painted....formless clay waiting to be molded. Thru this exchange, i know that i will become more than i was before....the Master takes the raw material, or the blank canvas or the raw gemstone and brings out the inner lustre. In this experience, what many misinterpret is that they assume the Master imposes his will upon the sub and she becomes whatever he wants her to be. i would disagree....to me, the Master brings out the qualities of submission in a more pronounced way. Rather than being told to "act" in a submissive way, it is the submissive's role to remove veil after veil until who she becomes is the perfect reflection of devoted service and in serving her Master, she finds an inner joy and balance that comes from knowing that with each veil removed, each boundary crossed, she becomes MORE of who she already is. 

When i feel, hear and see my Master's pride in me, i know that i am elevated and adored above all women. i have truly given the Gift of my soul to him and in that exchange he becomes as bound to me as i am to him. That is the beauty of submission to me. There is a dynamic that exists where the more my Master asks of me, the more i am able to give, and then the deeper our bond becomes. It grows exponentially. The perfect yin/yang of the Master being the active principle in the TAKING and the submissive being the receptive in the GIVING.
My submission is expressed in many ways: on a physical, mental, emotional and spiritual level. Without all of these levels, again, it becomes merely a physical act. There is a sacredness to submission as well for me. Like prayer or other acts of devotion, it is living my life with an intention and focus that always strives for the highest, purest expression. Putting the relationship first...always searching within for ways to please and offer more of myself than i think i can. It is this going beyond and pushing limits that becomes the most important reward of submission for me...the place of empowerment and self knowledge and the resulting inner strength/transformation. It is also dancing with the inner Shadowself...the parts of me that are about fear and being taken on the journey by someone (the Master) who will be there to catch you so you never really fall. The most special part of submission for me is level of intimacy and soul connection with another. Each veil that is removed, each boundary crossed, each lash accepted and begged for, each time of being taken to the outermost regions of letting go of control.....all of this is the glue that binds the Master and sub completely to one another. To become completely naked and vulnerable on every level, then give more than i think i can and see the pride, love and devotion in my Master's eyes is the greatest Gift imaginable.

Here's what happened. We all went to this underground club. It was me and David, A Dom/switch couple and another guy.( I am leaving names out for privacy reasons) We sat around for a while and drank and talked. David said he would be back, and I was buzzed by then, so I don't know actually how long he was gone. Then the fem switch comes up to me with cuffs and a chain in her hand, and says " I have been directed to do this".. i am pretty shocked, forgot exactly what i said but I put my wrists out. She puts the cuffs on my wrists and then connects them with a chain. I look at the other Dom and he is standing behind her with a straight face. I have no idea what is going on or what is gonna happen. My mind is just going 100mph. So then she pulls on the chain and says "Come with me".. So here I am being led away by her, and I look around and the few people that were didn't seem to notice too much. I am led up a set of stairs to this room. There He stood, and I am sure i was smiling from ear to ear. I look around and see that He has his floggers out. He was standng there, with a slight smile on His face, looking so damn sexy. I knew now what was going on. He knew that I had been wanting to scene for a while, but it just never seemed to happen, and no fault of His. He had gone out of his way to set this up for me. At that moment i just wanted to wrap my arms around Him and hug Him, but I maintained..lol..besides I couldn't have anyway because i was cuffed and chained. I won't go in to exactly what happened but it was awesome. I needed that. Everytime I think about it, it brings a smile to my face. 
Thankyou David, for making me feel very special.


I had to deal with a bit of drama when I got home that night. Not what I wanted to deal with after such an awesome evening, but that's life I guess.. take the good with the bad.

deb

i am so pissed off... my probation and parole teacher said on thursday, "i have the exam in front of me, there are 33 questions and i will give them to you"
so i'm like "cool", now i can get a 100 on my final and bring my final grade up to an A.. so she gives us the 33 questions, i go home, write the questions and answers on note cards and memorize every single one.. i go to class early and meet a few other students and we study together.. i think there is no way i'm not going to make a 100. 
so the time comes, we get the tests and i am writing like crazy, i know all of the answers.. but then there are 3 questions on there that she did not give us.. so i say something.. she admits that she did not give us these questions and kinda has his "tough luck" attitude.. so i sit there racking my brain trying to figure out the answers.. and i am getting madder and madder.. finally i give up and turn it in.. the to top it off on the way home one of the other students call me to let me know she knew the answers to them.. which just made it worse.. b/c my only hope was that no one would know the answers so she would cut us some slack, but not now.. and this girl works for DOC so of course she's gonna know the answers. 
i will still probably get and A, and end up with a B in the class, but i'm not happy. its the principal of it.. tell me what to fucking study. i am not a mind reader, and my college education is not a joke. and i don't enjoy being tricked or lied to..
